questions.question_text:
The following instructions were published about the proper network configuration for a videoconferencing device:
`Configure a valid static RFC1918 address accordingly to your network. Check the option to use a connection over NAT`.
Which of the following is a valid IP address configuration for the device?

discussion.content: An RFC1918 address is an IP address that is assigned by an enterprise organization to an internal host. These IP addresses are used in private networks, which are not available, or reachable, from the Internet.

feel sorry for anyone who got this question in a real exam, you can process of eliminate some of them, ipv6, the apipa etc, best bet in these rotten questions is pray god is behind you and trust your gut... logical thinking always with comptia exam..
since they said " Check the option to use a connection over NAT " I assumed that we need a private ip address...so the only private ip address is at D.
Until just now, I didn't know Network+ required the memorization of all the RFCs.

comments.content: NSLookup is a primary diagnostic tool for debugging a Domain Name System (DNS) architecture. The answer provided is correct (C).

discussion.content: I would think it's tracert as that provides all the hops which will help determine where the "network issue is located"

questions.question_text: While troubleshooting a connectivity issue, a network technician successfully pinged the loopback address and external DNS server but was unable to ping the website's URL. Which of the following tools should the technician use to determine where the network issue is located?

comments.content: disable ssid = ppl cant see it from outside only IT who know network ssid can join, "best enforce". this is truely better imo

discussion.content: I don't think that disabling SSID broadcast will be effective...I will go with A and F....any thoughts?

comments.content: Disabling the SSID doesnt prevent you from connecting to it....disabling the SSID broadcast is just a good way of helping to secure your wireless network as it will help prevent other people from detecting and knowing the SSID and you already know what the SSID is cause its yours. This way other people will not know your wireless network name when they go to see all of the available wireless networks.

discussion.content: how can I authenticate to the router if the SSID is disabled?

questions.question_text: A technician is helping to secure a wireless network at a home office and is looking to prevent unauthorized devices from connecting to the network. Which of the following would be BEST for the technician to do? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Here is how i think they came up with this answer. Say you are updating a router's config file. That file does not load your config changes until you issue the reload command. Hence, reinstall. Just my 2 cents.

comments.content: Maybe because they are devices, not files?

FIM is only a small paragraph in the CompTIA book. "re-computing a hashsum for the locally installed version and checking that is matches the known good value." Because it is reviewing key system files trying to match authorized versions I assume reinstalled is the best choice.
The question is referring to files on devices though...

I almost thought the same, but went with 'reinstalled' because the file would have to be downloaded, modified, and reinstalled in order for the monitoring service to flag it. Had the option been 'rewritten' then I would have chosen that, but not just 'written.'

questions.question_text: A network administrator has implemented file integrity monitoring on all relevant devices. This will provide the ability to detect whenever the files are:

discussion.content: Can someone explain why it isn't D? ITs a Private IP address?
Trick question, trunk isnt in the allowed interfaces. Thought it was A too
The trunk is set for Te interface not Gi interface that the vlan 1100 is let of

comments.content: My best guess is under "show interface trunk" it is missing VLAN 1101.

choices.D: The PC does not have a valid IP.
choices.C: The PC is in the wrong VLAN.
choices.B: The VLAN is not allows across the trunk.
